items.text: dirfts down the leg side and gets past Rahim's gloves as well as he misses the sweep

items.text: length on middle, blocked

items.text: pushed to cover for a quick one

items.text: back of a length, punched to extra cover who makes a diving stop

items.text: short of a length on off, punched to extra cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, no run

items.text: length on off, clears the front leg and drills it to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, no run

items.text: angles it into the pads and raps them as the batsman flicks across the line. Heading down leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 1 leg bye

items.text: back of a length, carves out a punch to point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: short of a length, slower, and he pulls early as the ball sneaks underneath the bat
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: short of a length, punched back
items.postText: Bangladesh firmly in control. But can West Indies switch on their T20 mode and pull off something special here? Shashank's here to tell you.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hetmyer, no run

items.preText:
Thanks, Akshay. I think the game is in the balance. Hetmyer has played a stylish knock and has somewhat recovered from the Gayle shock. Holder's batting has improved tremendously. I still think he's good enough to fit into this side just as a batsman. Can they take West Indies to within 100 of victory? Surely that has to be the first target.

NJ: "This is an apt platter for the Windies - a typical T20 situation: 15 overs and RR nearly 9 with only 2-3 recognized batsmen left."
items.text: driven firmly to long-off
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, 1 run

items.preText: Mahneel Musa: "Don't feel lonely, Dhaka is with you, Shashank." -- Makes me feel alive, mate.
items.text: he's chipped this straight to cover. The break in play has done the trick? Lovely from Mustafizur, landed this cutter at length, didn't get the elevation as Hetmyer wanted. Easy catch. That certainly swings it in Bangladesh's favour.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hetmyer, OUT

dismissal.text: SO Hetmyer c Shakib Al Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman 52 (78b 5x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

items.preText: Still no Russell. They're probably keeping him for the last seven or eight. It's Rovman Powell, who is also capable of bringing out the big hits. Let's see what he brings to the table. Sure going to be a challenge
items.text: nicked first ball and Fizz is on fire. The angle, bounce and a faint edge with an angled bat, Mushfiqur does the rest. Generally, he bowls from wide of the crease. This time he slanted this from close to the stumps, Powell reaches out to jab at this, only to get the nick. Big, big trouble.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Powell, OUT

dismissal.text: R Powell c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.preText: Russell now. Big job for him. Mustafizur on a hat-trick
items.text: driven through the line to mid-off
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Russell, no run

items.text: right behind the line as he defends.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Russell, no run

items.text: punched into the gap between cover and point to get off the mark.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Russell, 1 run

items.text: gets on top of the bounce and cuts this nicely towards square third man, excellent work there.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Russell, 1 run

items.text: hoicked away across the line to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, 1 run

items.text: muscled, on the bounce to wide long-on. Looks like Russell has come out looking to bring out the big hits immediately. May not be a bad thing for West Indies.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Russell, 1 run

items.text: massive! This is terrific. Gave himself some room and then flat-batted this length ball to clear wide long-on.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, SIX runs

items.text: top-edge and he's chipped this to the man running across from mid-off. The change of pace from Mash has done the trick. Holder was through with the stroke even before it got to him, tried to check it in the end but by then the sin had been committed. West Indies, after being in the fight for 35 overs, are unraveling here.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Holder, OUT

dismissal.text: JO Holder c Mosaddek Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 17 (18b 0x4 1x6) SR: 94.44

items.text: sways away from this attempted short ball
items.postText: Atiq: "@Shashank, is there any smart statistics from cricinfo like IPL for ODI?" -- Still being developed.
